item.description:
Bring your problems, puzzles, questions, epiphanies, solutions, triumphs and tribulations. It's Hack Night!

This months (STILL STILL very loose) agenda is:

1) Welcome to new people.
2) Open Code Reviews - a fast way to understand Ruby idioms. Bring a class or method and the group can tear it apart and build it up again (if needed...maybe *you'll* be teaching us a thing or two.)
3) Open problem solving, help with dev environments for new users, open discussion.
4) Lightning talks (If anyone has one they want to present.)
6) Dinner? This is up in the air. Post to the list what your desire is. We'll can break around 8:30 - 9:00 and go out for food on Rt-9 or we can plan on having food at the location. I know *I* plan on getting a beer or two after.

The point of this night is to solve your problems, share nifty hacks, and learn new stuff.

If you are completely new and want help setting up a Ruby development environment, bring your machine and you'll probably leave with a working development environment. I said probably. :)
item.how_to_find_us: You can't miss me. I'm bald, bearded and loud.
item.why: Ruby noobies can bring any problem/question and get ideas for solutions, or just downright solve it. Ruby experts have lots of opportunities to share their expertise, gain a fan-base, and move forward with their plans of world domination! Woot!
item.name: Meetup For March. Hack Night plus a presentation or two!
